channel.title: [317]Adding new RS Hitmarks[317]
channel.description:
Ok, this is VERY simple, but for those of you that don't know, I'll show you. Please no Flaming.
[b]Difficulty:[/b]0/10 [b]Purpose:[/b]To add new RS Hitmarks. [b]Things Needed:[/b] Tom's Cache Suite, My Hitmark Images. (Got from RS.)
[b]Download the Images:[/b] http://uppit.com/v/A0FY6MZ7 If you need a mirror please tell me.
[b]Download Tom's Cache Suite:[/b] http://www.nuke-net.com/?page_id=5
[b]Step 1:[/b] Load your client's cache. [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/333he11.png[/img]
[b]Step 2:[/b] 'View/Edit Image Archives' > 'Media' > 'Ok' [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/2nvcpp5.png[/img]
[b]Step 3:[/b] Scroll down the list until you find 'hitmarks.dat', 0 = Blue, 1 = Red, 2 = Green, 3 = Yellow, 4 = Yellow2. [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/10opgnq.png[/img]
[b]Step 4:[/b] Import the images. [IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/23jpk6o.png[/img]
[b]Step 5:[/b] Do Step 4 for, 0, and 1, 1 is the Red Hitmarks, 0 is the Blue Hitmarks. [IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/2mgwdoo.png[/img]
[b]Step 6:[/b] Click 'Save Archive' to Rebuild the Cache. [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/15hmtxl.png[/img]
[b]Result:[/b] [IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/29ojvac.png[/img]
Hope this helped, this was a very short tutorial so don't flame please. :o

item.title: [317]Adding new RS Hitmarks[317]
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

Ok, this is VERY simple, but for those of you that don’t know, I’ll show you. Please no Flaming.

Difficulty:0/10
Purpose:To add new RS Hitmarks.
Things Needed: Tom’s Cache Suite, My Hitmark Images. (Got from RS.)

Download the Images:
http://uppit.com/v/A0FY6MZ7
If you need a mirror please tell me.

Download Tom’s Cache Suite:
http://www.nuke-net.com/?page_id=5

Step 1:
Load your client’s cache.

Step 2:
‘View/Edit Image Archives’ > ‘Media’ > ‘Ok’

Step 3:
Scroll down the list until you find ‘hitmarks.dat’, 0 = Blue, 1 = Red, 2 = Green, 3 = Yellow, 4 = Yellow2.

10opgnq.png604×522

Step 4:
Import the images.

Step 5:
Do Step 4 for, 0, and 1, 1 is the Red Hitmarks, 0 is the Blue Hitmarks.

Step 6:
Click ‘Save Archive’ to Rebuild the Cache.

Result:

Hope this helped, this was a very short tutorial so don’t flame please. :o

Read full topic
